item.title: Formal Notice sent to U.S. Senator Chuck Grassley
item.description: Click on this link to visualize the original email: 2024-03-08_2358_0800_formal_notice_senator_chuck_grassley.pdf From: Vincent B. Le Corre Subject: 18 U.S. Code § 4 - FORMAL NOTICE: DO NOT IGNORE Date sent: March 08, 2024, 23:58 +0800 (China Standard Time) To: Chuck Grassley (U.S. Senator) Click on this link to visualize the original email: 2024-03-08_2358_0800_formal_notice_senator_chuck_grassley.pdf Dear Senator Grassley, Please be advised that this communication constitutes a formal notice under 18 U.S. Code § 4. Your attention to its contents is imperative and should not be disregarded.

item.title: White-Collar-Criminals.org, Urgent Accusation Against Steve Easterbrook: A Call for Immediate Response
item.description: Click on this link to visualize the original email: 2015-12-15_2255_0800-mcdonalds-ceo-steve-easterbrook-notified-about-white-collar-criminals-com.pdf From: Vincent B. Le Corre Subject: Right of reply Date sent: December 15, 2015, 22:55 +0800 (China Standard Time) To: Steve Easterbrook Click on this link to visualize the original email: 2015-12-15_2255_0800-mcdonalds-ceo-steve-easterbrook-notified-about-white-collar-criminals-com.pdf Overview of the Accusation Against Steve Easterbrook On December 15, 2015, I sent a decisive email to Steve Easterbrook, then CEO of McDonald’s Corporation, labeling him a white-collar criminal. This email not only challenged Easterbrook but also implicated McDonald’s Corporation in severe allegations of criminal activities.
